title: Drawing, "Pynson Wilmot Bennitt's Room, Trinity College, Oxford", 1857
medium: Brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on paper
signed: On the verso (following the inscription): AFP
inscribed: On the verso: Pynson Bennitt's room. Trin: Coll: Oxon:/ 23rd May 1857.
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; Sotheby's, London, April 26, 1990, lot 375
dimensions:
Old frame H x W x D: 33 x 35.6 x 4 cm (13 in. x 14 in. x 1 1/2 in.)
Sheet: 13.8 x 17.8 cm (5 7/16 x 7 in.)
description: The gentleman's study in this view is dominated by a large rectangular table covered by a wine-colored cloth. The desk in the far right corner is placed at a window to catch the light. A stag's head is mounted on the wall between the windows, while elk horns, pictures and a book shelf hang on the wall to the right. Blue tufted furniture, a patterned carpet and vases of flowers, all omnipresent elements of the Victorian period, are featured here.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Pynson Wilmot Bennitt's Room, Trinity College, Oxford", 1857.
1857. Brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on paper. Thaw Collection. 2007-27-62.
